name: Palmeraie Golf Palace & Resort

reviews.text: First, let me say that I too was robbed at this hotel - my ipod and Sennheiser headphones disappeared from my bag in my room. This is possibly some kind of record for the percentage of TA reviewers who are robbed whilst on their trip.
reviews.title: A conference hotel of minimal interest to individual travellers

likes.liked: — Good size suites overlooking the lake
likes.disliked: — Too much furniture cramped in - take out the bar and bar stools!

reviews.text: I never meant to stay here, but my colleagues were at another (full) resort and I was bumped into one of the villa suites here. These are not bad, on the face of it - half a mile from the main building are 40 suites (5 blocks of 8) with a private reception, check-in, (small) pool and bar, all overlooking the lake and golf course. You can order a big room service breakfast and sit on your terrace overlooking the lake. The suites are large but not huge (70 sq m?) and are too cramped - there is proper bar in the room, for a start, which wastes space. Furnishings are smart but the finish is not great - you can (literally) see the cracks.
reviews.title: A resort, far, far away

likes.disliked: — too far away from the city

reviews.text: Take a buggy down to the main building and it all goes downhill. Despite Ernst & Young seemingly block-booking the place, the majority of the shops and restaurants were closed and a lot of constuction was going on. There was literally nowhere open to buy coffee and a snack - only the formal restaurants - and no shop of any sort (there are about 10 but all were closed, possibly Ramadan or possibly just not high season). Staff regularly chat to themselves and ignore you. The best thing on offer is the ludicrously huge pool complex which I pretty much had to myself. Pool service is non-existant, though - forget being served drinks or snacks. There aren't even any convenient showers, since non-suite guests can easily pop into their rooms. I don't play golf so can't comment on the course. The business centre was OK.
reviews.title: Disastrous

reviews.text: Overall, I can't think of a single reason why an individual traveller would want to come here. Why go to a conference hotel where 95% of the guests know each other and eat / drink en masse, leaving you feeling out of it? Service standards are geared to the conference market - lets say no more. The villa suites are not bad, and if you really wanted to be on the golf course then take one of these - at least you're away from the main building. And, of course, lock up all your belongings because there seens to be a 1 in 4 chance you'll be robbed looking at these reviews.
reviews.title: Spendy but
Mint Tea!
reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights at the palmeraie golf palace. It is a real resort, wiht a lot of restaurants (4: japanese, itialian, morrocan). A lot of various activities like sports (golf!! of course, tennis, bowling, and many more). The rooms are fabulous, spacious, with a sitting area, the bed is comfortable and the bathroom is of a good size.

This hotel is stunning. I should point out from the beginning though that I went as part of a corporate "do" and I think this made a difference. Everything was perfect for us as the whole experience was booked and paid for including all meals and transport, trips etc. The hotel corridors are a bit like Eschers "magic eye" drawings where the staircases and busy patterns make you dizzy! The room we stayed in was lovely with complimentary robes, slippers, soaps, body oil (mmmmm....) cotton wool, nail file, etc it was just fab.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel for corporate parties.

reviews.text: The food was delicious and well presented.
reviews.title: Gastroenteritus Palace

likes.liked: — Beautiful gardens, pools and fountains and flowers everywhere. Large room, good towels
likes.disliked: — Bath enamel worn and tiles chipped in bathroom

reviews.text: The grounds are well tended and very beautiful.
reviews.title: sickness!!
d.i.y colonic irrigation
reviews.text: Luckily we had our trips and transport pre arranged but i would imagine it would be tricky and costly to get into Marrakech itself which is a good 20 min drive away. i think the hotel have a minibus though.

reviews.title: Slimming the painful way
reviews.text: For me this was a five star experience but if I went with my family on a usual holiday I can imagine there would be a few more snags, saying that everyone was helpful and the hotel is gorgeous so I cant imagine not enjoying it under any circumstances.

Hotel looks lovely from the outside, I was very impressed with the architecture and the huge conference rooms we used through out the day. The inside of the hotel is huge, and you could get lost very easily.
reviews.title: Simply could not sleep!

likes.disliked: — a lot of insects inside the rooms

reviews.text: We went in July, and the heat inside was terrible. Although every room had an air con, the AC did not work properly. I have been to 3 different other rooms where my friends stayed and it was the same problem.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great facilities, but a bit dated and dodgy service

likes.liked: — The pool, and the piano bar
likes.disliked: — Poor aircon, smelly hallways, poor service

reviews.title: lovely hotel, but service needs improvement
reviews.text: In terms of cleanliness, I would rate the hotel (1/10)

description: This unique palace, built in the traditional Marrakchi style, is a door opened on the Moroccan culture and architecture. Relax in this luxurious resort nestled in a legendary palm grove. Experience a warm and friendly atmosphere in a peaceful and elegant place.
